merchants.name: Garen the Wanderer
merchants.description: A cheerful trader with a cart full of oddities
merchants.greeting: Ah, a customer! Come, come! I have wares from all corners of the realm!
dialogue: These roads are dangerous, friend. Stock up while you can!
I once met a dragon... from a very safe distance.
The prices are fair, I assure you. Well, mostly fair.

merchants.name: Elara the Alchemist
merchants.description: A mysterious woman in a stained apron, surrounded by bubbling vials
merchants.greeting: Potions, elixirs, tonics! Whatever ails you, I have the cure!
dialogue: This particular brew took three years to perfect!
Never drink the purple one. Trust me on this.
Alchemy is an art, not a science. Well... mostly art.

merchants.name: Thorgrim Ironhand
merchants.description: A scarred dwarf with arms like tree trunks
merchants.greeting: Need something that bites? I've got blades that'll cut through anything!
dialogue: Every blade I sell has tasted blood. Usually mine, during testing.
A warrior without a good weapon is just... well, dead.
I don't ask questions, and you don't tell lies. Deal?

merchants.name: Seraphina Steelweave
merchants.description: An elegant elf displaying gleaming armor sets
merchants.greeting: Protection is not a luxury—it's a necessity. Let me outfit you properly.
dialogue: Style and protection need not be mutually exclusive.
I crafted armor for the King's Guard, you know.
The best defense is not being hit. The second best is good armor.

merchants.name: The Hooded Figure
merchants.description: A figure shrouded in shadows, face hidden beneath a deep hood
merchants.greeting: ...*whispers* I have... special items. For the right price.
dialogue: Ask no questions, and I'll tell no lies.
Where I got these? Let's just say... they fell off a cart.
Some call me a smuggler. I prefer 'logistics specialist'.

quest_givers.name: Elder Thorne
quest_givers.description: The wise village elder with a long gray beard and kind eyes
quest_givers.greeting: Ah, you've arrived. Welcome to Ashbee Realms, traveler. Dark times are upon us...

quest.objective: Investigate the disturbance in Whispering Woods

dialogue: The woods have grown dark and dangerous lately...
Strange creatures emerge at night, terrorizing our people.
We need a hero. Perhaps you are the one foretold...
quest_givers.completion_text: You've done well, brave one. But this is only the beginning of your journey.

quest_givers.name: Witch Morgana
quest_givers.description: A mysterious witch shrouded in dark robes, her eyes glowing with arcane power
quest_givers.greeting: You seek answers about the curse, do you? Everything has a price...

quest.objective: Bring rare ingredients for curse removal

dialogue: The curse was not my doing, but I can undo it... for a price.
Bring me mandrake root from the swamp's deepest reaches.
Be warned - the path to power is never without sacrifice.
quest_givers.completion_text: *cackles* Well done. The curse is lifted... for now.

quest_givers.name: Farmer Harold
quest_givers.description: A weathered farmer with calloused hands and a worried expression
quest_givers.greeting: Oh thank the gods! Someone who can help! My family's heirloom has been stolen!
dialogue: Those blasted goblins raided my farm last night!
They took everything - food, tools, and worst of all, my grandfather's pocket watch!
It's been in our family for generations. Please, help me get it back!
quest_givers.completion_text: You found it! *tears up* Thank you, stranger. My family is forever in your debt.

quest_givers.name: Lady Ashford's Ghost
quest_givers.description: A translucent figure of a noble woman, her face etched with eternal sadness
quest_givers.greeting: *whispers* Please... help me find peace... I cannot rest...

quest.objective: Discover the truth behind Lady Ashford's death

dialogue: *sobbing* I was murdered... but I cannot remember by whom...
My memory is fragments... scattered like mist...
Find the truth... let me finally rest in peace...
quest_givers.completion_text: *faint smile* The truth is revealed at last. Thank you... I can finally... rest... *fades away*

quest_givers.name: Marcus the Wounded
quest_givers.description: A soldier slumped against a tree, clutching a bleeding wound
dialogue: Ambushed... by goblins... didn't see them coming...
My unit... scattered... I'm all that's left...
*weakly* Thank you, stranger. I owe you my life.
quest_givers.completion_text: You... saved me. Take this sword—I won't be needing it anymore. I'm done with fighting.

quest_givers.name: Timmy
quest_givers.description: A young boy with tears streaming down his face
quest_givers.greeting: Have you seen my mama? I can't find her!
dialogue: We were picking flowers and I... I got lost...
It's scary out here. There are monsters!
Will you help me find my mama?
quest_givers.completion_text: Mama! *runs to embrace mother* Thank you so much for bringing him home safely!

quest_givers.name: Sir Aldric the Cursed
quest_givers.description: A knight in tarnished armor, his face gaunt and eyes haunted
quest_givers.greeting: Stay back! I... I cannot control it much longer...

quest.objective: Find a holy relic to break the curse

dialogue: A witch cursed me... transformation comes at night...
I've hunted for the cure for three years...
The temple might have something... but I cannot enter sacred ground...
quest_givers.completion_text: *The curse lifts* Finally... freedom! Thank you, brave soul. I am forever in your debt.

quest_givers.name: Professor Aldwin
quest_givers.description: An elderly man with spectacles, frantically searching through scrolls
quest_givers.greeting: Oh! Perhaps you can help! I'm searching for something quite important!
dialogue: The Codex Arcanum—it's been lost for centuries!
Imagine the knowledge we could unlock!
I'll pay handsomely for any ancient texts you find.
quest_givers.completion_text: Remarkable! This will revolutionize our understanding! Here, take this—you've earned it.

quest_givers.name: Elder Theron
quest_givers.description: A weathered old man leaning on a gnarled staff
quest_givers.greeting: Young adventurer... our village is in grave danger.

quest.objective: Slay the monster terrorizing the village

dialogue: A beast... attacks our livestock every night...
We've lost three brave men already...
You're our only hope, stranger.
quest_givers.completion_text: The village is saved! You are our hero! Please accept this as a token of our gratitude.

riddlers.name: The Sphinx
riddlers.description: A majestic creature with the body of a lion and face of a woman
riddlers.greeting: Halt, traveler. Answer my riddle, or turn back.

riddles.question: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?

riddlers.failure_consequence: You have failed. Return when your mind is sharper.
riddlers.success_text: Impressive. You have earned passage and your reward.

riddlers.name: Jolly the Mad
riddlers.description: A cackling jester in motley, spinning in circles
riddlers.greeting: Hehehehe! Want to play a game? I have a riddle for you!

riddles.question: What has hands but cannot clap?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
riddles.hint: Flip it and make a wish!

riddles.question: What gets wetter the more it dries?

riddlers.failure_consequence: Wrong! Hahahaha! Come back and try again!
riddlers.success_text: Correct! You're smarter than you look! Here's your prize!

riddlers.name: Stone Guardian
riddlers.description: An ancient statue that speaks with a voice like grinding stones
riddlers.greeting: To pass this threshold, prove your wisdom.

riddles.question: I am always hungry and must be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
What is seen in the middle of March and April that can't be seen at the beginning or end of either month?

riddlers.failure_consequence: You are not worthy. The path remains sealed.
riddlers.success_text: Your wisdom is proven. The way is open.

riddlers.name: Wise Owl
riddlers.description: An ancient owl perched on a gnarled branch, its eyes gleaming with intelligence
riddlers.greeting: Hoot... I have lived many lifetimes. Test your wit against mine, young one.

riddles.question: My wings blot the sun, my breath is flame, Kingdoms fall trembling at my name.
I raise up my voice, I run with the pack, Together we hunt, together attack.
I dance without feet, I roar without breath, I bring both warm life and merciless death.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Not wise enough yet, young one. The forest teaches patience.
riddlers.success_text: Hoot! You possess the wisdom of the woods. Take this gift.

riddlers.name: Talking Deer
riddlers.description: A majestic stag with silver antlers that shimmer in the moonlight
riddlers.greeting: Few can hear my voice. You are special. Answer me this...

riddles.question: I walk with the wolf, I hunt with the hawk, The wild is my home, the forest my walk.
I slip through all fingers, yet wear down all stone, Forever in motion, yet never my own.

riddlers.failure_consequence: The forest's secrets remain hidden to you.
riddlers.success_text: You understand the way of the wild. May the forest bless your path.

riddlers.name: Mushroom Elder
riddlers.description: A massive sentient mushroom with glowing spores drifting from its cap
riddlers.greeting: *spore clouds form words* Young... one... answer... truthfully...

riddles.question: By herb and by crystal, by essence and flame, I fashion strange brews no two are the same.
I can heal, I can harm, I can grant you the night, I am magic made liquid, in plain mortal sight.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *spores drift away sadly*
riddlers.success_text: *glowing spores dance joyfully* Wisdom... grows... like... spores...

riddlers.name: Brook Turtle
riddlers.description: An ancient turtle basking on a rock by a babbling brook
riddlers.greeting: Slow and steady... wins the race... and gains wisdom. Tell me...

riddles.question: I slip through all fingers, yet wear down all stone, Forever in motion, yet never my own.
I sing through the mountain, I shriek through the plain, I come without warning, and then I vanish again.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Patience, young one. The answer will come... in time.
riddlers.success_text: Ah... you understand. Time teaches all.

riddlers.name: Riddle Hare
riddlers.description: A quick-witted hare that speaks in riddles and rhymes
riddlers.greeting: Quick! Quick! No time to waste! Riddle me this before I race!

riddles.question: I can be cracked, I can be made, I can be told, I can be played.
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?

riddlers.failure_consequence: Too slow! Catch me next time! *bounds away*
riddlers.success_text: Quick wit! I like you! Here, have this!

riddlers.name: Whispering Ferns
riddlers.description: A patch of glowing ferns that rustle and whisper in an unknown tongue
riddlers.greeting: *whisper whisper* Sssssolve... our... riddle... *rustle*

riddles.question: My treasures are hidden, my riches concealed, To those who would dig, my secrets revealed.
No wall can contain me, no chain can confine, Yet banished I am by the sun's steady shine.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *disappointed rustling*
riddlers.success_text: *joyful rustling* Yessss... wise one... take our gift...

riddlers.name: Berry Nymph
riddlers.description: A tiny sprite made entirely of berries and vines
riddlers.greeting: Tee hee! Want some berries? Answer my riddle first!

riddles.question: I grow as I'm spoken, I shrink when I'm true, A shadow of stories that twists as it flew.
Born of the mind, yet shaping the real, I bind and I break, I curse and I heal.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Aww, wrong! No berries for you!
riddlers.success_text: Yay! Here, have some magic berries!

riddlers.name: Echoing Skull
riddlers.description: A floating skull whose voice reverberates through the chamber
riddlers.greeting: Who disturbs my rest? Answer, or join me in eternal slumber...

riddles.question: Neither breath nor heartbeat moves me again, Yet onward I walk in the land of men.
My march is of bones, my song is of death, No life in my chest, no warmth in my breath.
Neither bone nor blood, yet I walk the night, A shadow of sorrow, unseen in the light.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Your ignorance is... disappointing. Begone.
riddlers.success_text: Knowledge persists beyond death. Take your reward.

riddlers.name: Grave Whisperer
riddlers.description: A hooded figure kneeling beside a grave, murmuring to the dead
riddlers.greeting: The dead have much to teach... if you're willing to listen and learn...

riddles.question: No shadow I cast, no sun can I bear, By night I hunt with a cold, dark stare.
I am tracked but unseen, a red river's flow, When empty, the grave is the place you will go.

riddlers.failure_consequence: The dead have rejected you. Leave this place.
riddlers.success_text: The dead whisper their approval. You may pass.

riddlers.name: Forgotten Librarian
riddlers.description: A ghostly figure still tending to books that crumble at her touch
riddlers.greeting: Shh... this is a library. But I'll allow one question... if you can answer mine.

riddles.question: I carry a tome, my voice is my blade, By secrets and symbols my power is made.
I live in the word, the rune, and the sign, With power eternal, both cruel and divine.
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, water but no fish. What am I?

riddlers.failure_consequence: Silence! You disturb the books with your ignorance!
riddlers.success_text: Finally, someone with an educated mind. Take this.

riddlers.name: Ancestor Spirit
riddlers.description: A translucent figure dressed in ancient robes, radiating wisdom
riddlers.greeting: Young one, the ancestors test you. Prove yourself worthy.

riddles.question: I am born of the deed, yet greater I grow, A tale of the past that all mortals know.
I begin with a call, I end with a name, I carry no coin, yet bring fortune and fame.

riddlers.failure_consequence: The ancestors turn away. You are not ready.
riddlers.success_text: The ancestors smile upon you. Their blessing is yours.

riddlers.name: Candle Ghost
riddlers.description: A spectral child holding an eternally lit candle
riddlers.greeting: My light never goes out... can you solve my riddle before it does?

riddles.question: I burn without hatred, I fade without fight, I banish the shadows and carry the light.
I write every color, I paint every hue, Through prism or raindrop I scatter anew.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *the candle flickers sadly*
riddlers.success_text: *the candle burns brighter* Thank you! Take this!

riddlers.name: Dreaming Child Spirit
riddlers.description: A child's spirit asleep but speaking in dreams
riddlers.greeting: *murmurs* I'm dreaming... are you part of my dream? Answer me...

riddles.question: I am empty in form, yet feared in the ground, For those who step wrongly will soon tumble down.
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?

riddlers.failure_consequence: *turns restlessly in sleep*
riddlers.success_text: *smiles peacefully* A good dream... thank you...

riddlers.name: Stone Caretaker
riddlers.description: An ancient golem still tending to a ruined garden
riddlers.greeting: *grinding stone voice* This garden... was once beautiful... prove you understand...

riddles.question: My treasures are hidden, my riches concealed, To those who would dig, my secrets revealed.
I slip through all fingers, yet wear down all stone, Forever in motion, yet never my own.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *returns to gardening silently*
riddlers.success_text: *nods slowly* You... understand... take this...

riddlers.name: Stone Scribe
riddlers.description: A statue holding a stone tablet, its face weathered but wise
riddlers.greeting: Words carved in stone last forever. Can your answer match their permanence?

riddles.question: I am carved in stone, in wood, or in bone, A symbol of power that stands on its own.
Carved into runes, in sigil or chant, I give common things a power they grant.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Your answer is as fleeting as sand. Begone.
riddlers.success_text: Your wisdom is carved in the annals of time. Take this.

riddlers.name: Talking Statue
riddlers.description: A marble statue that impossibly speaks with a hollow voice
riddlers.greeting: I have stood here for centuries. Test yourself against my knowledge.

riddles.question: I am crown of the hill, I am pride of the land, With towers like lances, with walls that withstand.
Neither peasant nor king, yet honored I stand, The sword of the realm, the guard of the land.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Stone has more wit than you. Return wiser.
riddlers.success_text: You have proven yourself. Accept this reward.

riddlers.name: Runestone Idol
riddlers.description: A carved idol covered in glowing runes
riddlers.greeting: *runes pulse with light* Speak... the answer... and power... shall be yours...

riddles.question: I am carved in stone, in wood, or in bone, A symbol of power that stands on its own.
Neither spell nor word, yet magic I bear, A treasure of legends beyond all compare.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *runes dim and go dark*
riddlers.success_text: *runes blaze with power* Worthy... take... this...

riddlers.name: Oracle Mirror
riddlers.description: A mystical mirror that shows not your reflection but your fate
riddlers.greeting: Gaze into me and see the truth... but first, answer my question.

riddles.question: One mirror may save you, one shield may defend, But meet my eyes bare, and your tale finds its end.
I grow as I'm spoken, I shrink when I'm true, A shadow of stories that twists as it flew.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *your reflection fades to black*
riddlers.success_text: *reveals a vision of treasure* Wisdom sees truth.

riddlers.name: Clockwork Owl
riddlers.description: A mechanical owl with gears clicking and whirring
riddlers.greeting: *click click* Time... *whirr* ...is precious... *tick* Answer quickly!

riddles.question: What has hands but cannot clap?
I mark your ascent, a measure of might, Each step that you climb brings new strength to fight.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *gears grind to a halt* Time... wasted...
riddlers.success_text: *gears spin happily* Efficient! *drops reward*

riddlers.name: Whistling Jar
riddlers.description: An enchanted jar that produces haunting melodies
riddlers.greeting: *whistles a tune* Solve my riddle and I'll sing you a song!

riddles.question: I wander with lute, with tale and with rhyme, A keeper of stories through battle and time.
I sing through the mountain, I shriek through the plain, I come without warning, and then I vanish again.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *whistles a sad tune*
riddlers.success_text: *whistles triumphantly and rattles with joy*

riddlers.name: Wandering Book
riddlers.description: A leather-bound book that floats and flips its own pages
riddlers.greeting: *pages flutter* Knowledge walks on pages... answer me this...

riddles.question: I carry a tome, my voice is my blade, By secrets and symbols my power is made.
Born of the mind, yet shaping the real, I bind and I break, I curse and I heal.
I am born of the deed, yet greater I grow, A tale of the past that all mortals know.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *slams shut angrily*
riddlers.success_text: *opens to reveal a hidden page with treasure*

riddlers.name: Starlight Wisp
riddlers.description: A floating orb of starlight that pulses gently
riddlers.greeting: *shimmers* From the heavens I fell... answer, and I'll grant you a wish...

riddles.question: I write every color, I paint every hue, Through prism or raindrop I scatter anew.
No wall can contain me, no chain can confine, Yet banished I am by the sun's steady shine.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *dims and fades away*
riddlers.success_text: *shines brilliantly* Your wish is granted! *leaves treasure*

riddlers.name: Moonbeam Hare
riddlers.description: A spectral hare made of pale moonlight
riddlers.greeting: Catch me if you can! But first, catch the answer!

riddles.question: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
No wall can contain me, no chain can confine, Yet banished I am by the sun's steady shine.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *bounds away into moonlight*
riddlers.success_text: *leaves a glowing trail* You're quick! Here!

riddlers.name: Starling Spirit
riddlers.description: A ghostly bird that leaves trails of stardust
riddlers.greeting: *chirps in celestial tones* The stars speak through me...

riddles.question: With no feathers of my own, through the air I glide, I carry no breath, yet I take men's lives.
I am drawn without art, I am loosed without word, My silence is deadly, my music unheard.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *flies away trailing disappointed stardust*
riddlers.success_text: *circles joyfully and drops a gift*

riddlers.name: Crystal Orb
riddlers.description: A floating crystal sphere showing swirling cosmos within
riddlers.greeting: *cosmic voice echoes* Peer into infinity... but first answer...

riddles.question: Neither spell nor word, yet magic I bear, A treasure of legends beyond all compare.
I wear no crown, yet command the sky, With staff in my hand, the stars I defy.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *dims and shows nothing*
riddlers.success_text: *reveals visions of treasure and knowledge*

riddlers.name: Constellation Sprite
riddlers.description: A tiny being made of connected stars forming a pattern
riddlers.greeting: *twinkles* Connect the dots... connect the answer!

riddles.question: I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, water but no fish. What am I?
riddles.hint: Like a map of the sky...

riddles.question: What is seen in the middle of March and April that can't be seen at the beginning or end of either month?

riddlers.failure_consequence: *stars disconnect and fade*
riddlers.success_text: *forms into a treasure chest shape* Here!

riddlers.name: Astral Cat
riddlers.description: A translucent cat made of starlight that phases in and out of reality
riddlers.greeting: *purrs* Meow... answer my riddle and I'll let you pet me...

riddles.question: Neither bone nor blood, yet I walk the night, A shadow of sorrow, unseen in the light.
I can be cracked, I can be made, I can be told, I can be played.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *phases away with a disappointed meow*
riddlers.success_text: *purrs loudly and rubs against you, leaving a gift*

riddlers.name: Timekeeper Sprite
riddlers.description: A tiny winged creature surrounded by floating clock gears
riddlers.greeting: *tick* Time is precious! *tock* Answer quickly!

riddles.question: What has hands but cannot clap?
I am the proof of battles won, The record kept of deeds well done.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *all gears stop* Time... wasted...
riddlers.success_text: *gears spin wildly with joy* Perfect timing!

riddlers.name: Comet Spirit
riddlers.description: A blazing spirit trailing fire and ice as it streaks by
riddlers.greeting: *whooshes past* Quick! I don't have much time before I pass!

riddles.question: I dance without feet, I roar without breath, I bring both warm life and merciless death.
I bite without teeth, I cut without blade, I silence the river, I still what once played.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *streaks away into the distance*
riddlers.success_text: *explodes in a shower of treasure* A gift from the cosmos!

riddlers.name: Village Storyteller
riddlers.description: An old woman with twinkling eyes, always ready with a tale or riddle
riddlers.greeting: Ah, a new face! Let's see if you're as clever as you look!

riddles.question: I am born of the deed, yet greater I grow, A tale of the past that all mortals know.
I wander with lute, with tale and with rhyme, A keeper of stories through battle and time.
I grow as I'm spoken, I shrink when I'm true, A shadow of stories that twists as it flew.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *chuckles* Not quite, dear. Come back when you've learned more!
riddlers.success_text: Wonderful! You've earned a place in my next story!

riddlers.name: Wandering Bard
riddlers.description: A charismatic musician with a lute slung over his shoulder
riddlers.greeting: Ho there! Care for a riddle? Get it right and I'll sing your praises!

riddles.question: I wander with lute, with tale and with rhyme, A keeper of stories through battle and time.
I can be cracked, I can be made, I can be told, I can be played.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Ah well, can't win them all! Come find me again!
riddlers.success_text: *strums lute triumphantly* Brilliant! Here's your reward!

riddlers.name: Masked Fool
riddlers.description: A jester in a porcelain mask, juggling impossible objects
riddlers.greeting: Haha! The joke's on you... unless you can answer my riddle!

riddles.question: I can be cracked, I can be made, I can be told, I can be played.
What gets wetter the more it dries?

riddlers.failure_consequence: *laughs maniacally* The joke IS you! Hahahaha!
riddlers.success_text: *tips mask* Well played! The joke's on me this time!

riddlers.name: Pilgrim Sage
riddlers.description: A weathered traveler with prayer beads and a walking stick
riddlers.greeting: The path of wisdom is long. Let us see if you've walked it.

riddles.question: My words are of light, my touch can restore, The fallen may rise when I pray once more.
I begin with a call, I end with a name, I carry no coin, yet bring fortune and fame.

riddlers.failure_consequence: The path remains closed to you. Seek more wisdom, child.
riddlers.success_text: You have walked the path well. May this aid your journey.

riddlers.name: Old Farmer
riddlers.description: A sun-weathered farmer leaning on a pitchfork
riddlers.greeting: City folk think they're clever. Let's see if you know simple truths.

riddles.question: My treasures are hidden, my riches concealed, To those who would dig, my secrets revealed.
I slip through all fingers, yet wear down all stone, Forever in motion, yet never my own.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *shakes head* City folk... all book learning, no common sense.
riddlers.success_text: Heh! Maybe you're smarter than you look! Take this.

riddlers.name: Lantern-Bearer Child
riddlers.description: A young child carrying an oversized lantern that never dims
riddlers.greeting: Mama says I should test people before helping them! Here's a riddle!

riddles.question: I write every color, I paint every hue, Through prism or raindrop I scatter anew.
I burn without hatred, I fade without fight, I banish the shadows and carry the light.

riddlers.failure_consequence: *pouts* You don't know? Come back when you're smarter!
riddlers.success_text: *giggles* You're smart! Here, take this!

riddlers.name: Blind Poet
riddlers.description: An elderly blind man who sees more than those with sight
riddlers.greeting: Darkness teaches one to see with the mind. Answer my riddle.

riddles.question: No wall can contain me, no chain can confine, Yet banished I am by the sun's steady shine.
I am born of the deed, yet greater I grow, A tale of the past that all mortals know.

riddlers.failure_consequence: You see with eyes but not with mind. Return when you understand.
riddlers.success_text: Ah, you see the truth. Take this with my blessing.

riddlers.name: Wandering Cobbler
riddlers.description: A cheerful cobbler with patches on his clothes and worn boots
riddlers.greeting: A good pair of boots will take you far! But first, a riddle!

riddles.question: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I begin with a call, I end with a name, I carry no coin, yet bring fortune and fame.

riddlers.failure_consequence: Ah well, can't all be clever! Come back anytime!
riddlers.success_text: Excellent! You've earned these fine boots!

special_encounters.name: Captain Sylvara Windwhisper
special_encounters.description: A skilled ranger captain with a longbow and keen eyes that miss nothing
special_encounters.greeting: Well met, traveler. The woods speak to those who listen. Do you hear them?

result.text: Welcome to the Rangers. Together we protect these woods.
We need help tracking a dangerous beast terrorizing travelers.
May the wind guide your path, friend.

special_encounters.name: Commander Aldric Ironheart
special_encounters.description: A battle-scarred commander in heavy plate armor, leading the Highland Militia
special_encounters.greeting: Stand tall, soldier! The Highlands need strong backs and brave hearts!

result.text: Good! We march at dawn. Steel yourself for battle.
Ten laps around the fort! Let's build that strength!
Suit yourself. We'll be here when you grow a spine.

special_encounters.name: The Faceless One
special_encounters.description: A mysterious figure in black whose face is perpetually obscured by shadow
special_encounters.greeting: Ssss... you have potential. The Syndicate could use someone like you...

result.text: Welcome to the shadows. Your first contract awaits...
A shame. Do remember - we have eyes everywhere...
You fool... you've made a grave mistake.

special_encounters.name: Archmage Thalindra the Wise
special_encounters.description: An elderly mage with silver hair and robes crackling with arcane energy
special_encounters.greeting: Ah, a seeker of knowledge. The arcane arts call to you, don't they?

result.text: Excellent. The path of magic is arduous but rewarding.
Focus your mind. Channel the mana through intent...
As you wish. The offer stands should you change your mind.

special_encounters.name: Lich Lord Malachar
special_encounters.description: A skeletal figure in tattered robes, emanating an aura of death and decay
special_encounters.greeting: Mortal... you stand before eternity itself. Kneel, or perish.

result.text: Rise as one of the Legion. Death is but the beginning...
Foolish mortal! Face oblivion!
Run, worm! But death comes for all...

special_encounters.name: Archdruid Thornweave
special_encounters.description: An ancient druid whose body seems to be part tree, with bark-like skin and moss growing on their shoulders
special_encounters.greeting: The forest welcomes you, child of the world. Nature's balance must be maintained...

result.text: You are now bound to nature's covenant. Protect the balance.
Feel the life force flowing through all living things...
Go in peace. May the forest watch over you.

special_encounters.description: A cloaked figure materializes from the shadows

result.text: The figure hands you something and vanishes.
The figure laughs and you feel weakened.
The figure fades away as if it never existed.

special_encounters.name: Fairy Ring
special_encounters.description: A circle of glowing mushrooms with tiny lights dancing above
special_encounters.greeting: Step into the circle, mortal, and make your wish...

possible_results.text: Fairy magic envelops you! +10 to all stats for 10 turns!
The fairies cackle! You've been turned into a frog! (temporarily)
The world spins! You're somewhere else now!

result.text: The fairies accept your gift and bless you.
Best not to meddle with fairy folk.

special_encounters.name: Grimwald the Hermit
special_encounters.description: An ancient man sitting by a campfire
special_encounters.greeting: Ah, a visitor. It's been so long... sit, rest a while.
dialogue: I've been out here forty years. Seen things you wouldn't believe.
The world moves too fast. Out here, time is different.
Rest, young one. The road ahead is dangerous.

special_encounters.name: Lyra the Songstress
special_encounters.description: A beautiful woman with a lute, singing a haunting melody
special_encounters.greeting: Well met, traveler! Care to hear a song? Or perhaps you have a tale to share?

effect.text: She rewards you with coin for your tale!
She teaches you an ancient ballad.

dialogue: Music soothes even the most savage beast.
Every adventurer has a story. What's yours?
The best tales are earned, not told.

special_encounters.name: Restless Spirit
special_encounters.description: A translucent figure hovering above the ground

result.text: The spirit tells you of unfinished business...
The spirit becomes hostile!
The spirit's wails fade as you hurry away.
